Main goals

Make more accessible the Land-use harmonization (LUH2) data, once these data are in netcdf format that is not manageable in ecology analysis. And provide new data from the raw data. 

```{r LUH2_1, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, out.width= "70%", paged.print=TRUE, fig.align = "center"}
knitr::include_graphics("https://luh.umd.edu/images/LUH2_logo300.jpg")
```
---
The Land-use Harmonization 
```{r LUH2_2, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, out.width= "40%", paged.print=TRUE, fig.align = "center"}
knitr::include_graphics("https://luh.umd.edu/images/LUH2_logo300.jpg")
```
 - primf: forested primary land
 - primn: non-forested primary land
 - secdf: potentially forested secondary land
 - secdn: potentially non-forested secondary land
 - pastr: managed pasture
 - range: rangeland
 - urban: urban land
 - c3ann: C3 annual crops
 - c3per: C3 perennial crops
 - c4ann: C4 annual crops
 - c4per: C4 perennial crops
 - c3nfx: C3 nitrogen-fixing crops

---

Thus... 

1- I converted the raw data in Tagged Image Format File (.tif extension) that is a more common format used in ecology analysis. 

2- Created a new data from the raw data

---
Why do I do  this ?

Mapping the Land-Use Land-Cover (LULC) changes through time is important and desirable in many fields in ecology like to predict the threats or propose effective conservation policies and many others (Jetz,Wilcove, Dobson, 2007).
 
---
Issues

However many databases have a time-series limitation. Contrary of many databases, LUH2 covers historical, current and future LULC projections.

---
How did I do this ?

I built R scripts following these steps : 
1- To extract one by one layer 
2- To save each single layer (which is a continuous layers) as a TIFF format, 
3- To perform an analysis to combine all classes, generating categorical data, that's is new data produced here (LULC).
4- To validate LULC new data (in progress...)
```{r workflow, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, paged.print=TRUE, out.width = "60%"}

knitr::include_graphics("https://github.com/Tai-Rocha/LUH2_Data/blob/master/doc/Figures/LUH2%20_LULC.png?raw=true")

```
